header.title: 'Who does he think he is?' Farage BLASTS Bercow over furious rant against 'sexist' Boris
header.subtitle: NIGEL Farage has hit out at arrogant John Bercow and called for the House Speaker to be removed from his position after he accused Foreign Secretary Boris Johnson of being sexist earlier today.
header.postText: Speaking on his LBC show, Nigel Farage claimed the latest reprimand to Foreign Secretary Boris Johnson proved the House of Commons' Speaker is incapable of being impartial and should not be representing the nation in Parliament.', 'Mr Farage said: Oh dear, oh dear, oh dear. It’s painful.', 'I mean, let’s discuss in a minute whether or not what Boris did was sexist, but who does this person think he is?', 'Is this the Messiah who’s come back to correct us all and put us on the right path?', 'LBC•BBC', 'It is arrogant, it is stuck up, it is full of virtue signalling and, more importantly, he again and again and again, is incapable of being impartial.', 'He clearly takes the other side of the argument. Just a few weeks ago I reported on this show a car sticker that was on the front of his range rover which said a nasty word about Brexit.', 'He’s not impartial, my view is that it is time for him to be removed.', 'In a year and two days we’re going to get back the independence of our nation and with it the sovereignty of people in this country and they will be represented in Parliament.', 'Surely, a sovereign Parliament back in charge of our nation’s affairs deserves better than this.', 'Boris Johnson was forced to apologise to shadow foreign secretary Emily Thornberry after he referred to her as Baroness whatever-it-is and Lady Nugee, her husband’s name.', 'Speaker Bercow interrupted the debate accusing the Foreign Secretary of name-calling and being frankly sexist.', 'He said: We do not address people by the titles of their spouses.', 'The Shadow Foreign Secretary has a name and it is not ‘Lady-something’ and it is inappropriate and frankly sexist to speak in those terms, and I’m not having this in this chamber.', 'That is the end of the matter… it will not be allowed and you will be called out on it.', 'Boris profusely apologised, saying: May I crave your indulgence just to prostrate myself before you and to apologise for any inadvertent sexism or discourtesy that you may have deemed me to have been guilty of.', 'And I heartily tender my apologies to the right honourable lady opposite if she was offended by what I said. I meant no harm, Mr Speaker and I apologise unreservedly if I have offended the feelings of the right honourable lady.'
header.socioLingVar: Physical Identity - Physical (and Mental) Impairments,Age - Youngsters,Nationality - European or anti-Europeans,Gender - General,Ethnicity - General,Social Class - Working class

commentThread.commentText: I demand we remove Bercow as he is bias and a traitor to the British people.  The speaker needs to be impartial.  remove him now.

replies.commentText: "A traitor"? How the hell do you justify that? To people like you, disagreeing with your particular view is "treason" but your desire to suppress opposing views is akin to treason against democracy itself. The speaker needs to be allowed to call members to order when they breach protocol as seriously as Johnson did or he would betray his duty to maintain respectful debate in the commons. Every single MP knows that you address other members of the house as "The honourable" followed by member, gentleman or lady though the preferred term is member. This protocol is there for a very good reason, to maintain respect for other MPs. If the speaker let Johnson's breach of protocol slip through the crack he would create a precedent for name calling in the house and soon it would be utter chaos serving nobody in this country. You have to make your mind up at some point.You either want a parliament with a speaker that maintains protocol to ensure to fairness on which a democratic parliament depends in order to function or you don 't want a working parliamentary democracy at all - in which case any calls from you for a "sovereign parliament" is null and void.
referendum?
So to you being 'impartial' means agreeing with you? Boris's remark was obviously sexist.

commentThread.commentText: Who does this person think he is? The Speaker of the House of Commons, acting with all the authority that is rightly conferred upon that office, upon the advice of the Clerk, who is an expert of Parliamentary procedure. Whilst the question of sexism will do doubt rumble on, there can be no doubt that Johnson's conduct was entirely unparliamentary, and the Clerk quite correctly advised the Speaker to issue a rebuke. If Farage had ever been successful it getting elected to Parliament, judging by some of his dubious performances in the EU equivalent, no doubt he too would be on the receiving end of the Speaker's sharp tongue.Perhaps that 's why he empathises so with Boris on this occasion!

Nobody has the guts to chuck him out though. I guess he suits the communists who desperately want to upset our country and bring it down.
